newsitem.title: GERMANY: Eastern Germans drown sorrows with Erich's Revenge.
newsitem.headline: Eastern Germans drown sorrows with Erich's Revenge.

text.p: First there was Vodka Gorbachev. Now there is "Erich's Revenge", a vodka named after former Communist ruler Erich Honecker and fast becoming eastern Germany's fastest-selling tipple.
Feared and loathed in communist East Germany, Honecker was ousted from power in October 1989 days before the Berlin Wall came down. He died in Chile in 1994.
But his unpopularity has not stopped former subjects guzzling his namesake to reminisce about the old days.

"Erich's Revenge", a series of four vodka-based drinks launched in May in east Germany, is selling at a rate of one million bottles a month and fast overtaking its competitors, marketing manager Uwe Dahlhoff said.

"Eastern Germans drink three times the amount of spirits as western Germans. They sit round together, drink vodka and reminisce about old times," said Dahlhoff of the family drinks firm Dahlhoff near the western city of Dortmund.
The firm withdrew a previous product "Helmut Cool", named after Germany's Chancellor Helmut Kohl, after chancellery officials express disapproval, Dahlhoff said.
